column1: Goodlettsville's Davidson County portion has two elementary schools and one middle school: Goodlettsville Elementary School
column3: and Goodlettsville Middle School.  Goodlettsville schools feed into Metro Nashville Schools' Hunters Lane cluster
column4: meaning that students tend to move from Goodlettsville Middle School to Hunters Lane High School upon completion of 8th grade and promotion to 9th grade.

column1: On the Sumner County side of the line
column2: the only school within the city limits is Madison Creek Elementary School
column3: which feeds to Hunter Middle School and Beech Senior High School in Hendersonville. A portion of the city is zoned for Millersville Elementary
column4: which feeds White House Middle and High Schools.

column1: Goodlettsville residents on the Sumner County side have the option of sending students to Sumner County's Merrol Hyde Magnet School
column2: if the students meet its criteria. Furthermore
column3: residents on the Davidson County side have the opportunity to send students to Head Magnet Middle School
column4: which feeds to Martin Luther King Jr. Academic Magnet
column5: or Meigs Magnet Middle which feeds to Hume Fogg Academic High School. Both Meigs and Head have academic requirements.

column1: A little league team from Goodlettsville participated in the 2012 Little League World Series in Williamsport
column2: PA where they won the United States Championship and qualified to play for the World Series title against the international champion. They were the fifth team from Tennessee to qualify in series history
column3: and the first to play in the championship game.  They lost to a team from Tokyo
column4: Japan in the finals. They were the first Tennessee team to qualify since 1987.  As tournament runners-up
column5: they were the most successful Tennessee team since 1985.  They were the first to win at least two consecutive games since 1974.  And
column6: they were the first Nashville area team to qualify since 1970.  It was only the second year for little league baseball in Goodlettsville.

column2: a second little league team from Goodlettsville qualified for the World Series

column5: falling one game short of the World Series championship game. The team finished fourth in the world after next losing the consolation game against a team from Panama

column1: Goodlettsville is incorporated under the City Manager/Commission charter. The Board of Commissioners is made up of five members elected at-large.  The five members then select a Mayor and Vice-Mayor within themselves
column2: much like a board selects a chair and vice-chair.  The current mayor is Jeff Duncan
column6: and Rusty Tinnin.  The Goodlettsville City Commission is elected to serve four year
column7: alternating terms.  Elections are held every two years. Timothy "Tim" J Ellis serves as city manager and manages all day-to-day operations of the city.
